channel.title: Small sorcerer change suggestion
channel.description: I think sorc should passive should be changed so besides knights and night immune targets she will not attack members of the unseen/cult. She will still not know who the unseen/cult is but at least she won't be able to randomly kill them, and she will still lose a night if she accidentally targets one of them. If this would make her too powerful she could be nerfed somewhere else, like making her dust single target again or removing her immunity to poison/bleeding.

item.title: Small sorcerer change suggestion
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Eran_Shmuel:

If you remove inquisitor/ make the sorc not attack unseen/cult then the sorc is just an extra unseen, with an evil king it can go to 5 unseen at the start, n4 and they got majority

But the sorcerer doesn’t know who the unseen/cult are.

Eran_Shmuel:

The inquisitor is made to balance the sorc win condition. Yes inquisitor winrate should be the highest win rate in the game because he can win almost every game that the natural killer doesn’t win.

No class deserves a hardcounter, even if they’re easy to win. The hardcounters are overpowered against that class and easy to win, especially if they counter an evil class. Inquisitor is also overpowered against the cult, which needs a buff.

item.title: Small sorcerer change suggestion
item.dc:creator: Bart_Auringer
item.description:
I just hate that Inq keeps his abilities more than anything.

It’s crazy terrible in a cult game where you can’t ever kill him with your limited killing ability and he just goes down the line killing and outting everyone.

And honestly… even if he didn’t exist, I don’t think Sorc would win that much. The Win Condition isn’t exactly easy. I’ve seen it happen like once ever and it was pure dumb luck and stupidity from the BD that it happened.

Sorc needs a way to get a message to Evil, not that it matters since half the time they bus the Sorc anyway.

item.title: Small sorcerer change suggestion
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
You don’t know if they are immune or not however. Just that you didn’t attack them.

You either

A: Kill them (unless they were healed)
B: get the message that you felt danger and didn’t attack as a result
C: Hit the inquisitors night immunity.

Anything else looks exactly like those 3 options.
